messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Looking for...
messages.msgSnippet: The light is reflected off the lighter clothing causing less of the heat from the sun to be absorbed by the person wearing them. Like bouncing? Show how light
messages.messageBody:
The light is reflected off the lighter clothing causing less of the heat
from the sun to be absorbed by the person wearing them. Like bouncing? Show
how light reflects (bounces off) different things with a flashlight or
better yet one of those laser pointers.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Jessi" <mistycal@...>
To: <unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>; <unschooling-list@...>
Sent: Sunday, February 24, 2002 8:21 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Looking for...


a simple explanation to why dark clothes absorb more heat than light
colored :o) I can't explain it in kid language hehehehe

Jessi





<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**
Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to
solve.
~ Roger Lewin ~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Looking for...
messages.msgSnippet: ... White light is made up of all the colors. When white light hits a colored object, it reflects the light of the color of the object and absorbs the rest,
messages.messageBody:
on 2/24/02 8:21 PM, Jessi at mistycal@... wrote:

> a simple explanation to why dark clothes absorb more heat than light
> colored :o) I can't explain it in kid language hehehehe

White light is made up of all the colors. When white light hits a colored
object, it reflects the light of the color of the object and absorbs the
rest, turning it into heat. Since white is made up of all the colors a white
object reflects back all the light that hits it and absorbs none of it.
Black relfects back none of it and absorbs all of it.

Joyce


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
